title: HTML Layout Elements and Techniques
gp1: Websites often display content in multiple columns (like a magazine or a newspaper).
gp2: HTML has several semantic elements that define the different parts of a web page
gp3: If you want to create your layout fast, you can use a CSS framework, like W3.CSS or Bootstrap.
gp4: It is common to do entire web layouts using the CSS float property. Float is easy to learn - you just need to remember how the float and clear properties work. Disadvantages: Floating elements are tied to the document flow, which may harm the flexibility. Learn more about float in our CSS Float and Clear chapter.
wp1: Use of flexbox ensures that elements behave predictably when the page layout must accommodate different screen sizes and different display devices.
wp2: The CSS Grid Layout Module offers a grid-based layout system, with rows and columns, making it easier to design web pages without having to use floats and positioning.
